summary: This bill, the Rectifying Undefined Descriptions of Abusive Acts and Practices Act (or Rectifying UDAAP Act), amends the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010. It clarifies standards for the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection (BCFP) regarding enforcement of Unfair, Deceptive, or Abusive Acts or Practices (UDAAP).  Key provisions include defining 'abusive,' requiring rulemaking on civil penalties and UDAAP definitions, limiting discriminatory interpretation of UDAAP authority, clarifying good-faith efforts to comply, and establishing notice and cure period. It also specifies where enforcement actions can be brought and places limitations on the BCFP's look-back enforcement periods.
